title: Keira Knightley shows off her post baby body during the Official Secrets premiere in London
text:
She welcomed her second child with husband James Righton just over a month ago.

And Keira Knightley looked absolutely radiant as she showed off her post-baby body while attending the premiere for Official Secrets during the BFI London Film Festival on Thursday night.

The actress, 34, proved to be absolutely perfect in a whimsical white midi-dress with a sensational white lace overlay.

Pretty: Keira Knightley, 32, looked radiant as she showed off her post-baby body while attending the premiere for Official Secrets during the BFI London Film Festival on Thursday

Keira stunned in the figure-skimming number which put emphasis on her tiny waist which fell at an ankle-grazing length.

The semi-sheer detailing on her top half boasted ruched sleeves as well as floral detailing.

The British beauty showed off her striking features with a glamorous coat of make-up, which complemented her tousled wavy brunette locks.

Boosting her height in a pair of glamorous gold peep-toe heels, Keira looked happy and relaxed as she signed fan autographs and posed for snaps.

Standing tall: Boosting her height in a pair of glamorous gold peep-toe heels, Keira looked happy and relaxed as she signed fan autographs and posed for snaps

This marks Keira's first red carpet appearance since giving birth to her second child.

Keira and husband James confirmed that they had welcomed their second child on September 13 by taking the tot on a stroll in London. The pair have reportedly named the child 'Delilah.'

Keira and James married in France in May 2013 and welcomed their first child, daughter Edie, in 2015.

Meanwhile, Official Secrets is the hotly anticipated political thriller which tells the tale of a real-life Iraq War whistleblower.

There she is: This marks Keira's first red carpet appearance since giving birth to her second child

Proud parents: The pair have reportedly named the child 'Delilah'

Film: Official Secrets is the hotly anticipated political thriller which tells the tale of a real-life Iraq War whistleblower

Keira takes on the role of British Intelligence Officer Katharine Gun, who leaked a confidential email to The Observer in 2003, which revealed top-secret plans by the US to spy on the UN security council.

When The Observer broke the story, former Mandarin-language translator Gun was arrested and charged under the Official Secrets Act, causing public backlash.

Her trial took place in early 2004, but authorities soon dropped the case, and she was famously backed by celebrities including actor Sean Penn.

Directed by Gavin Hood, the film is based on the book The Spy Who Tried to Stop a War: Katharine Gun and the Secret Plot to Sanction the Iraq Invasion.

The film will be released in the UK on October 18.
